Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday September 30), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, september 30th.

amazon is ramping up its efforts in the healthcare sector. the tech giant announced the expansion of its telehealth service, amazon care, to additional cities across the united states. this move comes as part of amazon’s broader strategy to capture a more significant share of the healthcare market, which is estimated to be worth trillions of dollars. amazon care aims to provide both virtual and in-person care services, bringing convenience and accessibility to its users.

microsoft has unveiled a new suite of ai tools aimed at small and medium-sized businesses. these tools, under the banner of microsoft 365 copilot, are designed to help companies streamline operations, manage finances more effectively, and enhance customer engagement. ceo satya nadella emphasized that these innovations are part of microsoft's commitment to empowering every organization and individual to achieve more.

meanwhile, google's parent company, alphabet, is making waves in the autonomous vehicle industry. waymo, alphabet's self-driving car unit, is expanding its robo-taxi services to more cities, including los angeles and chicago. this expansion marks a significant milestone in the race to commercialize autonomous driving technology. waymo's ceo highlighted the company's rigorous safety standards and advanced ai capabilities as key factors contributing to its success.

lastly, facebook is rolling out new features to enhance user privacy on its platform. the social media giant announced that it will introduce encrypted voice and video calls on messenger, aiming to provide users with more secure communication options. this move aligns with facebook's ongoing efforts to bolster privacy and security across its services.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, september 30th.

amazon is ramping up its efforts in the healthcare sector. the tech giant has announced the expansion of its telehealth service, amazon care, to additional cities across the united states. this move comes as part of amazon’s broader strategy to capture a more significant share of the healthcare market, which is estimated to be worth trillions of dollars. amazon care aims to provide both virtual and in-person care services, bringing convenience and accessibility to its users.

microsoft has unveiled a new suite of ai tools aimed at small and medium-sized businesses. these tools, under the banner of microsoft 365 copilot, are designed to help companies streamline operations, manage finances more effectively, and enhance customer engagement. ceo satya nadella emphasized that these innovations are part of microsoft’s commitment to empowering every organization and individual to achieve more.

meanwhile, google's parent company, alphabet, is making waves in the autonomous vehicle industry. waymo, alphabet's self-driving car unit, is expanding its robo-taxi services to more cities, including los angeles and chicago. this expansion marks a significant milestone in the race to commercialize autonomous driving technology. waymo's ceo highlighted the company's rigorous safety standards and advanced ai capabilities as key factors contributing to its success.

lastly, facebook is rolling out new features to enhance user privacy on its platform. the social media giant announced that it will introduce encrypted voice and video calls on messenger, aiming to provide users with more secure communication options. this move aligns with facebook's ongoing efforts to bolster privacy and security across its services.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-118 Amazon's Healthcare Expansion 🏥, Microsoft's Ai Tools for Smbs 🤖, Waymo's Robo-taxi Rollout 🚖
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for monday, september 30th! explore today's top tech stories:

  • amazon expands telehealth services: amazon care is now available in more cities, providing both virtual and in-person healthcare services, enhancing convenience and accessibility.
  • microsoft ai tools for smbs: microsoft 365 copilot introduces ai-driven tools to help small and medium-sized businesses streamline operations, manage finances, and improve customer engagement.
  • waymo's robo-taxi expansion: alphabet's waymo extends its autonomous vehicle services to los angeles and chicago, emphasizing its advanced ai capabilities and rigorous safety standards.
  • facebook enhances privacy: facebook messenger introduces encrypted voice and video calls to offer users more secure communication options, reinforcing the platform's commitment to privacy and security.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image set in a futuristic cityscape at dawn, with the skyline subtly transitioning from a metropolitan hospital building on the left to high-tech office buildings in the center, and a bustling urban road on the right. the hospital, representing amazon's healthcare expansion, is sleek, modern, with gentle blue lighting, and features drones delivering medical supplies to the roof. the central office buildings glow with digital energy, symbolizing microsoft's ai tools for small businesses, with holographic data and ai interfaces faintly visible in their glass reflections. on the right, the urban road features waymo's autonomous taxis smoothly navigating the streets, their sleek designs illuminated by bright, green lights. the background seamlessly blends, moving from the calm, therapeutic blue around the healthcare facility to the vibrant greens and oranges around the robo-taxis, signifying efficiency and technological advancement. the entire image harmonizes elements of healthcare, ai, and autonomous transport into one visionary scene
